metadata.title: CVE-2021-4129 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers and community members Julian Hector, Randell Jesup,Gabriele Svelto, Tyson Smith, Christian Holler, and Masayuki Nakanoreported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 94. Some of these bugsshowed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effortsome of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 95, Firefox ESR < 91.4.0, and Thunderbird <91.4.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4129` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
